newsitem.title: UK: BSkyB up amid talk securities issue dropped.
newsitem.headline: BSkyB up amid talk securities issue dropped.

text.p: Shares in British Sky Broadcasting reversed early losses to firm 3.0 pence to 581-1/2 amid market runmours that News Corp is abandoning plans of issuing convertible preferred securities, market makers said.
BSkyB told Reuters it could not comment on any talk that Australia's News Corp was to revise its plans.
A week ago, NewsCorp said it intended to sell $1 billion of preferred securities for the purchase of stock in its 40 percent owned BSkyB.
Rumours that the the plan has been scrapped follow a British newspaper report on October 28 that the issue would be delayed by at least a week.
Shares in BSkyB initially fell after the satellite TV operator reported disappointing subscriber growth in its first quarter.
